article_metadata.description: The Waltham City Council passed a $2.1 million rental voucher proposal Monday night that will help 50 families secure affordable housing in Waltham.The program would use $2.1 million in Community Preservation Committee funds to create the voucher system, a proposed three-year program that would give the money to the Waltham Housing Authority, which would then provide the rental subsidies to participating landlords.On Monday, Dec. 28, the council voted 12-1 in favor of the proposal, with
article_metadata.author: Bill Whelan wwhelan@wickedlocal.com

og.title: Council approves rental vouchers
